title: 11.3 Hash Functions
content:
Section 11.3

Hash Functions

Summary

How to design good hash functions that distribute keys uniformly.

Key Points

  • Goal: each key equally likely to hash to any slot
  • Division method: h(k) = k mod m (avoid powers of 2 for m)
  • Multiplication method: h(k) = ⌊m(kA mod 1)⌋ where 0 < A < 1
  • Universal hashing: randomly choose h to prevent adversarial inputs
  • Cryptographic hashes for security applications

Example

Multiplication with A = (√5-1)/2 ≈ 0.618 (golden ratio) works well. For k=123, m=100: h = ⌊100(123·0.618 mod 1)⌋.

Why It Matters

Good hash functions are crucial for hash table performance.
